clinical_study.official_title: HI-VISION - Hypotension Myocardial Ischemia-Vascular Events In Noncardiac Surgery Patients: a Cohort Evaluation: Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective cohort pilot study of non-cardiac patients to determine the feasibility of recruiting 150 patients to undergo postoperative continuous hemodynamic monitoring for up to 3 days.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patient will start wearing the Philips' hemodynamic and ECG monitor in the Post Anaesthesia Care Unit (PACU). This device will continuously measure heart rate, pulse oxymetry, and ST-segments. The device will measure blood pressure every hour from 7 am to 10 pm and every 2 hours from 10 pm to 7 am.
Patients will have postoperative Troponin I monitoring and telephone follow-up at 30 days postop.

primary_outcome.measure: Hypotension and Hypoxemia (baseline patterns and frequencies)
primary_outcome.description: To identify baseline patterns and frequencies of hypotension and hypoxemia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Myocardial Ischemia (association between myocardial ischemia detected by the algorithm implemented by MX40 with Troponin I)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the association between myocardial ischemia detected by the algorithm implemented by MX40 with Troponin I.

secondary_outcome.measure: Myocardial Ischemia (delay in detecting myocardial ischemia based on MX40 monitoring versus Troponin I monitoring)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the delay in detecting myocardial ischemia based on MX40 monitoring versus Troponin I monitoring.

secondary_outcome.measure: Myocardial Ischemia (number of patients with missed clinically important hypotension, bradycardia, and hypoxia based on routine monitoring in clinical practice versus remote, automated, non-invasive hemodynamic monitoring)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the number of patients with missed clinically important hypotension, bradycardia, and hypoxia based on routine monitoring in clinical practice versus remote, automated, non-invasive hemodynamic monitoring.

secondary_outcome.measure: Myocardial Ischemia (delay in detecting clinically important hypotension, bradycardia, and hypoxia based on routine monitoring in clinical practice versus remote, automated, non-invasive hemodynamic monitoring.)
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the delay in detecting clinically important hypotension, bradycardia, and hypoxia based on routine monitoring in clinical practice versus remote, automated, non-invasive hemodynamic monitoring.

other_outcome.measure: Postoperative Pain (association between postoperative pain intensity and myocardial ischemia, nonfatal myocardial infarction, and cardiac mortality)
other_outcome.description: To determine the association between postoperative pain intensity and myocardial ischemia, nonfatal myocardial infarction, and cardiac mortality.

study_pop.textblock: Patients aged 45 or greater who present for noncardiac surgery with 2 or more risk factors for heart disease and will be receiving a general or spinal anesthesia with an anticipated length of stay of 3 days or more.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: We will enroll patients aged 45 years or older undergoing noncardiac surgery who fulfilled 2 or more of the following risk factors:
- History of coronary artery disease
- History of stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA)
- History of hypertension
- History of diabetes
- History of peripheral vascular disease
- History of congestive heart failure
- Preoperative creatinine > 175 umol/L
- A planned admission for â‰¥48 hours
- Patients receiving a general or regional anesthetic
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients unable to provide informed consent.
- Patients who undergo procedure performed under infiltrative or topical anesthesia.
- Patients previously enrolled in the HI-VISION Study.
- Patients who refuse 30-day follow-up.
